instance_url.description: The Url of the ServiceNow instance to work with.

password.description: Password of the user to manage resources.

username.description: Username used to manage resources in the ServiceNow instance using Basic authentication.

configuration_template.description: Sys id of configuration template of connection alias

connection_type.description: Type of connection. http_connection, jdbc_connection, basic_connection, or jms_connection

multiple_actions.description: If true, connection alias allows multiple active connections

name.description: Name of alias object.

retry_policy.description: Sys id of default retry policy of connection alias

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

type.description: Type of alias. credential or connection

block.description: `servicenow_alias` manages a connection and credential object within ServiceNow to provide connection details to a Flow Designer action.

name.description: The name of the Application to retrieve from the ServiceNow instance.

scope.description: The unique scope of the application. Normally in the format x_[companyCode]_[shortAppId]. Cannot be changed once the application is created.

block.description: `servicenow_application` manages an application within ServiceNow.

active.description: Whether or not this application is in use.

category_id.description: Specifies the menu category ID, which defines the navigation menu style. The default value is Custom Applications.

description.description: Used to provide a more detailed explanation of what this application does.

device_type.description: Type of device where this menu will appear. Can be 'browser' or 'mobile'.

hint.description: Defines the text that appears in a tooltip when a user points to a link to this application.

order.description: The display order for the application menu.

protection_policy.description: Determines how application files are protected when downloaded or installed. Can be empty for no protection, 'read' for read-only protection or 'protected'.

roles.description: Comma-separated list of Roles (names) that can view this application.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

block.description: `servicenow_application_menu` manages an application menu within ServiceNow creating a new section in the application navigator.

active.description: Whether or not this application module is in enabled.

application_menu_id.description: The application Menu ID where this module should reside.

arguments.description: Full name of the UI Page where this module will redirect when link type is 'DIRECT'. When the link type is 'LIST', this is optional.

hint.description: Defines the text that appears in a tooltip when a user points to this module.

link_type.description: Type of device where this menu will appear. Can be 'DIRECT' for a UI page link or 'LIST' for a table link.

order.description: The display order for the module in the application menu.

override_menu_roles.description: Show this module when the user has the specified roles. Otherwise the user must have the roles specified by both the application menu and the module.

protection_policy.description: Determines how application files are protected when downloaded or installed. Can be empty for no protection, 'read' for read-only protection or 'protected'.

roles.description: Comma-separated list of Roles (names) that can view this application module.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

table_name.description: The full name of the table where this module will redirect when the link type is 'LIST'.

title.description: Display name of the module in the application navigator.

window_name.description: The name of the browser window when clicking on a link. For example '_blank' can create a new tab.

block.description: `servicenow_application_module` manages an application menu within ServiceNow creating a link in the application navigator.

credential_alias.description: Sys ID for credential alias the credential is assigned to.

name.description: Name of basic auth credential object.

order.description: The order the credential will be use in a credential alias if multiple credentials are applied.

block.description: `servicenow_basic_auth_credential` manages a basic auth credential configuration within ServiceNow.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

style.description: Used when 'type' is set to 'local'. The raw CSS content of this style sheet.

type.description: The type of this content management style sheet. Can be 'link' or 'local'.

url.description: Used when 'type' is set to 'link'. Must be an absolute URL to an external style sheet file.

block.description: `servicenow_content_css` manages a style sheet(CSS) configuration within ServiceNow.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

style_sheet_id.description: The ID of the service portal style sheet to include.

block.description: `servicenow_css_include` manages a cascading style sheet(CSS) within ServiceNow.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

block.description: `servicenow_css_include_relation` manages a relation between a CSS include and a widget dependency within ServiceNow.

access.description: Whether this Script can be accessed from only this application scope or all application scopes. Values can be 'package_private' or 'public'.

alter_access.description: Used when access is set to 'public'. Allow other application scoped to run scripts that update data in this table.

configuration_access.description: Used when access is set to 'public'. Allow design time configuration of this table from other application scopes.

create_access.description: Used when access is set to 'public'. Allow other application scopes to run scripts that create data in this table.

delete_access.description: Used when access is set to 'public'. Allow other application scoped to run scripts that delete data in this table.

extendable.description: Allow other tables to extend this table.

label.description: The display name for this table that can be localized.

live_feed.description: Flag to determine if live feed should be enabled for this table.

name.description: The internal name of the table.

read_access.description: Used when access is set to 'public'. Allow other application scoped to run scripts that read data from this table.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

user_role.description: Role ID required for end users to access this table.

web_service_access.description: Used when access is set to 'public'. Flag to determine if web service calls can be made to this table.

block.description: `servicenow_db_table` manages a database table within ServiceNow.

api_name.description: Name of the extension point API, that is pre-pended with the application scope to which it applies. This is a system-assigned name and cannot be changed.

description.description: Description of the required implementation of the extension point.

name.description: Unique name of the extension point.

restrict_scope.description: Only allow extension instances within this point's scope.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

block.description: `servicenow_extension_point` manages a scripted extension point within ServiceNow.

active.description: If set to 'true', this property will enable the http connection.

connection_alias.description: Sys ID of associated connection alias configuration.

connection_url.description: Base URL of HTTP connection configuration.

credential.description: Sys ID of associated credential alias configuration.

mid_selection.description: Decides which mid server is used. auto_select or specific_mid_server

mid_server.description: Sys ID of associated mid server if in use.

name.description: Display name of the connection configuration.

use_mid_server.description: If true, the HTTP connection server will use a mid server.

block.description: `servicenow_http_connection` manages a HTTP connection configuration within ServiceNow.

access.description: Whether this Script can be accessed from only this application scope or all application scopes. Values can be 'package_private' or 'public'.

access_token_lifespan.description: Number of seconds a newly created access token is good for.

client_id.description: OAuth Client ID required during handshake.

client_uuid.description: Internal unique identifier of the entity.

name.description: Name of the OAuth app.

redirect_url.description: The OAuth app's endpoint to receive the authorization code.

refresh_token_lifespan.description: Number of seconds the refresh token is good for.

inactive.description: The recurring price associated with question choice.

order.description: The order the question choice will be displayed in a list of question choices.

price.description: The price associated with question choice.

question.description: The sys id of the variable/question the question choice is assigned to.

recurring_price.description: The recurring price associated with question choice.

text.description: Display text of the question choice.

access.description: Whether this REST message can be accessed from only this application scope or all application scopes. Values can be 'package_private' or 'public'.

rest_endpoint.description: The URL of the REST web service provider this REST message sends requests to.  Can contain variables in the format '${variable}'.

value.description: The value of the header to add to the HTTP request.

access.description: Whether this Script can be accessed from only this application scope or all application scopes. Values can be 'package_private' or 'public'.

active.description: Whether or not this Script Include is enabled.

api_name.description: Full name of the Script Include needed to call it.

client_callable.description: Whether or not this script can be called from the client-side or only server-side.

name.description: Display name of the script. Needed to have an api_name.

protection_policy.description: Determines how application files are protected when downloaded or installed. Can be empty for no protection, 'read' for read-only protection or 'protected'.

active.description: Activates the API. Inactive APIs cannot serve requests.

base_uri.description: The base API path (URI) to access this API.

doc_link.description: Specifies a URL that links to static documentation about the API.

enforce_acl.description: The ACLs to enforce when accessing resources. Individual resources may override this value.

name.description: The name of the API. Appears in API documentation.

namespace.description: The namespace the API belongs to. The value depends on the current application scope.

protection_policy.description: Determines how application files are protected when downloaded or installed. Can be empty for no protection, 'read' for read-only protection or 'protected'.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

service_id.description: The API identifier used to distinguish this API in URI paths. Must be unique within API namespace.

short_description.description: The description of the API. Appears in API documentation.

block.description: `servicenow_scripted_rest_api` manages a scripted REST API within ServiceNow.

active.description: Activates the resource. Inactive resources cannot serve requests.

enforce_acl.description: The ACLs to enforce when accessing resources. Individual resources may override this value.

http_method.description: The HTTP method that maps to this record. Can be 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'PATCH' or 'DELETE'.

name.description: The name of the API resource. Appears in API documentation.

operation_script.description: The script that implements the resource.

operation_uri.description: The resolved path of this resource including base API path, version, and relative path.

protection_policy.description: Determines how application files are protected when downloaded or installed. Can be empty for no protection, 'read' for read-only protection or 'protected'.

relative_path.description: The path of this resource relative to the base API path. Can contain templatized path paramenters such as /{id}.

request_example.description: An example of a request sent to this resource.

requires_acl_authorization.description: Enforce ACLs when this resource is accessed.

requires_authentication.description: Whether requests must be authenticated to access this resource.

requires_snc_internal_role.description: Whether requests must be authenticated with SNC Internal Role to access this resource.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

short_description.description: The description of the API. Appears in API documentation.

web_service_definition.description: The parent API this resource belongs to.

web_service_version.description: The version of the parent API this resource belongs to.

block.description: `servicenow_scripted_rest_resource` manages a scripted REST resource within ServiceNow.

assigned_to.description: Sys ID of user associated with server.

company.description: Sys ID of company associated with server.

cpu_core_count.description: Number of CPU cores associated with server.

cpu_count.description: Number of CPUs associated with server.

cpu_manufacturer.description: Sys ID of CPU manufacturer associated with server.

cpu_speed.description: CPU speed in MHz associated with server.

disk_space.description: Disk space in GB associated with server.

manufacturer.description: Sys ID of manufacturer associated with server.

model_id.description: Sys ID of model ID associated with server.

name.description: Display name of the server.

os_domain.description: Sys ID of user associated with server.

os_service_pack.description: Operating system service pack associated with server.

os_version.description: Version of operating system associated with server.

ram.description: Amount of ram in MB associated with server.

active.description: If set to 'true', the service catalog will be visible to users.

background_color.description: Background color of service catalog in hexidecimal format.

description.description: Comma-seperated list of sys ids of editor users capable of editing and updating catalog categories and items.

desktop_continue_shopping.description: A page name redirect for when a user clicks Continue Shopping.

desktop_home_page.description: A custom to redirect to when user clicks the catalog breadcrumb.

desktop_image.description: Path to desktop image displayed in service catalog

editors.description: Comma-seperated list of sys ids of editor users capable of editing and updating catalog categories and items.

enable_wish_list.description: If seto to 'true', wish list functionality will be visible in the service catalog.

manager.description: Sys ID of manager user capable of performing updates, edits, and deletions again items and categories within service catalog.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

block.description: `servicenow_service_catalog` manages a service catalog configuration within ServiceNow.

active.description: If set to 'true', the service catalog category will be visible to users.

catalog.description: Sys ID of service catalog the category is assigned to.

desktop_image.description: Path to image associated with service catalog category.

header_icon.description: Path to service catalog category header icon.

icon.description: Path to service catalog category icon.

location.description: Sys ID of location of service catalog category

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

title.description: Title of the service catalog category.

block.description: `servicenow_service_catalog_category` manages a service catalog category configuration within ServiceNow.

active.description: If set to 'true', this property will make a service catalog visible for use.

category.description: Service catalog category the service catalog item is assigned to.

mandatory_attachment.description: If set to 'true', this property will require an attachment when a service catalog item is used.

name.description: Display name of service catalog item.

no_attachment.description: If set to 'true', this property will hide the attachment button from the service catalog item.

no_cart.description: If set to 'true', this property will hide the add to cart button from the service catalog item.

no_delivery_time.description: If set to 'true', this property will hide the delivery time from the service catalog item.

no_quantity.description: If set to 'true', this property will hide the quantity parameter from the service catalog item.

no_wishlist.description: If set to 'true', this property will hide the add to wishlist button from the service catalog item.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

service_catalogs.description: Comma-seperated list of service catalogs the service catalog item is assigned to.

short_description.description: Short description of service catalog item.

block.description: `servicenow_service_catalog_category` manages a service catalog item configuration within ServiceNow.

active.description: If set to 'true', this property will enable the variable in the service catalog item.

catalog_item.description: The sys id of the catalog item the variable will be assigned to

default_value.description: Default value for the variable in catalog item.

help_tag.description: Help header of the variable in catalog item.

help_text.description: Help text for the variable in catalog item.

hidden.description: If set to 'true', this property will hide the variable in the service catalog item.

instructions.description: Additional instructions for the variable in catalog item.

list_table.description: The name of the ServiceNow table the catalog item will use to populate its list.

lookup_table.description: The name of the ServiceNow table the catalog item will use to populate its lookup list.

lookup_value.description: The name of the table value the catalog item will use to populate its lookup list.

mandatory.description: If set to 'true', this property will make completion of the variable mandatory.

name.description: Name of variable that will be referenced in scripts throughout ServiceNow.

order.description: The sys id of the catalog item the variable will be assigned to

question.description: Display name of the variable in catalog item.

read_only.description: If set to 'true', this property will make the variable read only.

reference.description: The name of the table the catalog item will use to populate its reference list.

reference_qualifier.description: The table filter applied to the reference lookup.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

show_help.description: If set to 'true', this property will enabling displaying additional help information with the variable.

tooltip.description: Tooltip hint of the variable in catalog item.

type.description: Type of variable to be used in catalog item.

block.description: `servicenow_service_catalog_variable` manages a service catalog variable configuration within ServiceNow.

choices.description: Comma-separated list of possible choices when the type is set to 'choicelist'. The values can be in format 'label=value' for alternate display labels.

description.description: Short description of the property that will be displayed above it in the UI.

ignore_cache.description: If set to 'true', changing this property will not flush the cache.

is_private.description: If set to 'true', this property will not move from one site to another.

name.description: Internal name of the property used to access it in scripts.

read_roles.description: Security roles required to read this property.

scope.description: Associates a resource to a specific application ID in ServiceNow.

suffix.description: Internal suffix for the property used to create the name.

type.description: Type of the property. This is used when displaying the input used in the UI to change the property.

write_roles.description: Security roles required to modify this property.
